keyMoments.title: Cabaji's Debut
keyMoments.description: Cabaji the Acrobat, Chief of Staff of the Buggy Pirates, makes his first appearance and challenges the Straw Hats.
keyMoments.significance: Introduction of Buggy's second-in-command and first major swordsman opponent for Zoro.
keyMoments.quote: I am Cabaji the Acrobat, Chief of Staff of the Buggy Pirates!

keyMoments.title: Defeat by Oni Giri
keyMoments.description: Despite using dirty tactics and targeting Zoro's wound, Cabaji is defeated by Zoro's Oni Giri technique.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Zoro's strength and determination even while injured.

abilities.description: Acrobatic combat style combining swordplay with circus tricks, performed on a unicycle.
Cabaji rapidly descends from the air with his sword positioned to stab his opponent.
Cabaji breathes fire at his opponents during battle.

relationships.description: Cabaji serves as Chief of Staff under Captain Buggy, showing loyalty and respect.

evolutionMoments.description: Cabaji offers to fight on Buggy's behalf to protect his captain.

relationships.description: Cabaji fights Zoro in a one-on-one duel and is defeated.

evolutionMoments.description: Cabaji challenges Zoro to a duel and loses via Oni Giri.

reveals.information: Chief of Staff of the Buggy Pirates
Master of acrobatic sword fighting style called Carnival Tricks

keyMoments.title: Oni Giri First Use
keyMoments.description: Zoro uses his signature Three Sword Style technique, Oni Giri (Demon Slash), to defeat Cabaji despite being injured.
keyMoments.significance: First use of one of Zoro's most iconic techniques, demonstrating his strength even while wounded.

abilities.description: Zoro crosses his swords across his chest and approaches the enemy, then slices through with all three swords simultaneously.

reveals.information: First use of Oni Giri, one of Zoro's signature Three Sword Style attacks

keyMoments.title: Luffy's Rage Over His Straw Hat
keyMoments.description: When Buggy damages Luffy's precious straw hat, Luffy becomes genuinely enraged, showing the deep significance of the hat given to him by Shanks.
keyMoments.significance: Reinforces the emotional connection between Luffy and his straw hat, and by extension, his promise with Shanks.

reveals.information: The straw hat is Luffy's most precious treasure, given to him by Shanks

keyMoments.title: Nami Steals the Grand Line Map
keyMoments.description: While Zoro battles Cabaji, Nami sneaks away and breaks into the pub to steal a map of the Grand Line from Buggy's treasure.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Nami's thieving skills and her dream of mapping the entire world, including the Grand Line.
keyMoments.quote: A map of the Grand Line! This will fetch a nice price!

reveals.information: Nami demonstrates her thieving and infiltration skills

keyMoments.title: Buggy's Grudge Against Shanks Revealed
keyMoments.description: After Luffy mentions Shanks' name, Buggy reveals that he holds a deep grudge against the Red-Haired pirate, cursing his name.
keyMoments.significance: First revelation of the connection between Buggy and Shanks, hinting at their shared history.
keyMoments.quote: Shanks! Don't you dare speak that name!

relationships.description: Buggy holds a deep grudge against Shanks, revealed when Luffy mentions his name.

evolutionMoments.description: Buggy's hatred of Shanks is revealed when Luffy mentions being friends with him.

reveals.information: Buggy has a grudge against Shanks
